body.p: Maurice had been working for months on his latest invention, the Heated-Nose-Muff-3000, preparing it for the Miami Inventors Fair. Despite Miami’s humid heat, he believed his product would catch on during the “cooler” 80-degree days – and maybe even up north. Even though Miami was a humid hell, he believed his product would catch on during the “cooler” 80-degree days – and maybe even up north.With big dreams packed into his Ford F-150, he headed off to the fair, ready to showcase his creation.

fig.title: Maurice's Ford F-150 on the way to the fair

image.alt: Rust red pickup truck with tinted windows

body.p: On his way to the fair, Maurice hit stand-still traffic on I-95, backed up for miles. Afraid that he would miss the fair, he pulled off the highway and decided to take a shortcut through the mysterious Everglades. He always avoided the wetlands, deterred by legends of a ferocious man-eating beast lurking in the Everglades... but those were just stories, right?

As nighttime soon came, Maurice’s shortcut went off track. He found himself deep in the Everglades, surrounded by murky water and twisted, decaying trees, with no exit in sight. Just as he was starting to lose hope, a large black castle emerged in the distance. Relieved, he parked his Ford and knocked at the door, only to find the door wide open with no lights on. Believing it was abandoned due to the spooky stories he heard, he marched right on in.

image.alt: Large black castle with spooky, twisted trees around it

body.p: Maurice was immediately intrigued by the castle and quickly discovered that the stories surrounding the wetlands may be true. A talking clock and candelabra greeted him! Maurice blinked twice and pinched himself to make sure he wasn’t dreaming, but the ghostly objects were real. This realization made him notice just how sleepy he was and closed his eyes to take a quick nap. The next he knew; he awoke in a cell.For a moment, he felt dizzy, and his heavy eyes started to close. He heard a large roar and the next thing he knew, he awoke in a cell with a sharp headache and metal shackles bound to his wrists and ankles.
